🎉In this video, we delve into the harrowing Uttarkashi Tunnel Disaster that struck on November 12, amidst Diwali celebrations. A catastrophic collapse at an under-construction tunnel in Uttarakhand trapped 41 workers, sparking a desperate, multinational rescue mission. Miraculously, after 17 days, the workers were saved, thanks to the relentless efforts of over 200 people. This disaster highlights the precarious state of the Himalayas, already shaken by the earlier Joshimath sinking. We examine the controversial Char Dham highway project at the heart of these calamities, a massive undertaking aimed at connecting holy sites but criticized for its ecological impact. The documentary sheds light on the government's handling of the project, the risks of tunnel construction in the fragile Himalayan region, and the broader implications of such development projects. Join us as we explore the fine line between natural and man-made disasters and the lessons to be learned from the Uttarkashi rescue operation.

हिंदू असल्याचे भासवून मोदीविरोधी, भाजपविरोधी, आरएसएसविरोधी आणि सनातनविरोधी (माहेश्वरी नाव नाही) खोटे पसरवणाऱ्या *ध्रुव राठी* बद्दल सत्य बाहेर आले आहे. *त्यांचे खरे नाव बद्रू रशीद, पूर्ण नाव बदरुद्दीन रशीद लाहोरी*. त्यांचा जन्म पाकिस्तानातील लाहोर येथे झाला आणि त्यांची पत्नी जुली (ख्रिश्चन नाव) देखील पाकिस्तानी आहे, तिचे खरे नाव झुलेखा (स्पष्टपणे मुस्लिम नाव) आहे. ते कुख्यात गँगस्टर दाऊद इब्राहिमच्या कराचीतील गुप्त आलिशान बंगल्यात राहतात, जिथे त्यांना ISI आणि पाकिस्तानी लष्कराची Y आणि Z सुरक्षा पुरवली जाते. बद्रू रशीद (ध्रुव राठी म्हणून बनावट) याला पाकिस्तान, चीन, दुबई, मालदीव, कॅनडा, रशिया, तुर्की आणि पांडोरा या देशांकडून निधी दिला जातो. जॉर्ज सोरोस यांच्या खात्यातून मोदींना विरोध करण्यासाठी पेसाला निधी पाठवला जातो. *पण आता हा हिंदुद्वेषी, भारतविरोधी घटक उघड झाला आहे. इस्रायलची गुप्तचर संस्था मोसादने आपल्या गुप्तचर अहवालात याचा खुलासा केला आहे.* सर्व सनातनींना विनंती आहे की, हा खुलासा जास्तीत जास्त शेअर करून देशहिताच्या दृष्टीने बद्रू रशीदचे सत्य सर्वांसमोर आणावे. 🇮🇳

Sad Reality of Uttarkashi Tunnel Rescue | 3D Animation | Dhruv Rathee

Summary

Summary:
Tunnel collapse incident in Uttarkashi on November 12, 2023, trapped 41 workers during Char Dham project construction.
Challenges faced during rescue mission included drilling methods, machine breakdowns.
Causes of collapse discussed: geological faults, construction methods in mountainous terrains.
Successful rescue after 17 days using manual drilling operation with rat hole miners.
Environmental impact of Char Dham project discussed, with violations of regulations and criticism from activists and experts.

Introduction and Tunnel Collapse

Introduction to the incident in Uttarkashi on November 12, 2023, where a tunnel collapsed trapping 41 workers. Details about the rescue mission and challenges faced.


Project Overview

Overview of the Char Dham project in Uttarakhand connecting four North Indian Dhams. Construction details and impact of the project.


Causes of the Collapse

Discussion on the possible causes of the tunnel collapse including geological faults and construction methods in mountainous terrains.


Rescue Operation Challenges

Details about the challenges faced during the rescue operation including drilling methods, machine breakdowns, and the eventual success of the operation.


Manual Drilling and Rescue

Description of the manual drilling operation using rat hole miners and the successful rescue of all 41 workers after 17 days of being trapped.


Environmental Impact and Project Criticism

Discussion on the environmental impact of the Char Dham project, violations of regulations, and criticism from activists and experts.

Although strategically located, Uttarkhand needs in-depth research and analysis in order to sanction a go ahead permit to any type of infrastructural works without compromising the national security and country's interest.
Not all problems can be tackled by military intervention, diplomatic shrewdness may be the key to address country's security on many occasions. But having said this, military deployment may be necessary whenever required and this will prompt infrastructure development from time to time when the neighboring country is some aggressor like China or Pakistan.

All government from time to time by the virtue of some of its ambitious projects has inflicted tremendous harm on nature, resources (both natural and human). Let not only criticize and allege the present BJP government for all the problems which India is today facing.

I have been to Uttrakhand for quite some time now. And here are a few things I would like to say - The Char Dham project is calling for some national disaster. I have seen construction works going on around Joshimath, Kedarnath and Badrinath. How fragile and unsustainable they are... I'm not from Uttrakhand but my heart and soul reside in Uttrakhand. The unmatchable beauty I have experienced only intrigued my mind to explore how we can protect this beautiful place. It aches my heart to know that in spite of knowing everything the government is doing this to Uttrakhand. Destroying the place for no good reason. Char Dham is supposed to be on foot, not by  luxurious cars.

I am a frequent traveler in north west Himalayan region. I must say that good infrastructure is the need of hour. 

There are still many places which are disconnected from rest of the country. 

However, infrastructure needs won’t give a license to destroy ecology. 

I am afraid to say that govt has adopted poor technique in these projects.  That’s why natural disasters are taking place such as washing of roads, Dams etc. 

One of the major reasons people aren’t talking about these days is that soil in Himalayan region especially in Middle and Lower region is loosing the holding capacity that results in fall of trees. 

WE ARE NOT AGAINST DEVELOPMENT BUT WE LOVE NATURE.

Your information is wrong.. fact is, there was a pipe used earlier to drain water from the tunnel. Workers were lucky that same pipe was re-used to push life saving essentials right from about 18 hours after tunnel collapse. It was not that rescuers drilled this pipe in. Simple logic, If rescuers could insert that pipe so easily within so short time, then rescuing workers was not at all a big challenge.  Was this pipe not there, workers would have suffocated inside. Also, lighting inside the tunnel was concealed wiring i.e. through pipe, hence there was lot of lighting inside, you are saying "Thode bahut roshni thi"..

My father has been going to badrinath on bike since 12 years, i joined him from last 2 years , and in 2022 we were stuck in 4 landslides which were normal the jcb machine first clears some space for bikers so we only had to wait 3 hours maximum for each landslide
but this year! In july 2023 we went through 20-24 landslides!! Stuck in each landslide while some of them were already cleared when we reached. 
There's a place called Lambagadh , the mountain is not so strong and it's famous for landslides, but the govt managed to make a wide road and a wall of rock there. Yes road construction is causing land slides it's a sad and bitter truth.
Talking about Joshimath, The whole mountain is full of water and glacier from inside, when it rains the water needs to breakout and it causes cracks on the upper surface. The road construction is not so responsible for joshimath

Subject: Appreciation for Druv Rathee's Commitment to Truth and Realism

Dear Druv Rathee,

I hope this note finds you well. I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere appreciation for the incredible work you do in creating true and fact-filled videos that shed light on various aspects of the Indian government and society.

Your dedication to presenting accurate information and highlighting realist factors is commendable. In an era where misinformation often spreads rapidly, your commitment to truth stands out. Your videos have become a valuable resource for those seeking reliable insights into the workings of the Indian government, addressing issues with transparency and depth.

It is evident that you invest considerable time and effort in research, ensuring that your content is well-informed and backed by verifiable facts. Your courage to discuss sensitive topics and challenge prevailing narratives reflects a genuine commitment to fostering a more informed and aware society.

Your videos not only educate but also encourage critical thinking and civic engagement. By addressing issues such as government policies, societal challenges, and black spots within the system, you contribute to a more transparent and accountable governance.

In a landscape where sensationalism often overshadows substance, your work serves as a beacon of integrity and authenticity. Thank you for being a voice for truth and for your dedication to creating content that empowers individuals to make informed decisions.

May you continue your impactful journey of enlightening the public and inspiring positive change.

Warm regards,
from: Praveen Nigam

Hello Dhruv, your videos and the information content is very good and in true words it's mind blowing. But I don't agree with the intent you argued in this video on the topic of Strategic angle. I don't understand your situation in this point. You need to understand one thing very clearly that only when our defence is strong and alert then only we can focus on our country's progress and development. The current government didn't want to notify anyone neither our people nor enemies and not our  neighbours the main idea behind constructing these roads. Our main moto has been keeping our borders safe and keeping our military logistics in proper running condition against China and Pakistan. So when the country's strategic interest was not getting achieved then our Government had to intervene to make every one understand the main idea and don't consider it a main reason behind constructing these roads. We hear a common quotation in every construction site - Today's pain in tomorrow's gain. It may surely happen that after construction of the roads are over then fresh new tree saplings can be planted to fill the gap which has developed. I agree in construction of these roads ecological disbalance has happened but you also have to understand if the journey time is getting reduced that means there's saving on petrol n diesel for both of us and the Government. And it will also encourage more tourism opportunities and also more job creation opportunities. We have to grow n develop and also adapt as the situation demands. Thanks 👍.

Why he have problems with religion

The purpose of pilgrimmage is to reach the abode of the divine after a lot of physical and financial struggle. Only after intense effort and devotion does the devotee get the fruits of darshan or spiritual and mental development. A pilgrimmage is not a sight-seeing visit or a pleasure trip. The char dham pretty much defeats the purpose of pilgrimmage and makes it another commercial tourist attraction to visit. Even with tourism and development, I doubt this project makes much commercial sense. Seems more like a political theater for the ruling party to burnish its image with religious voters.

My Understanding about what could be the reason of this tragedy and how can we prevent such tragedies? 


- Possible Reasons for Collapse:

1. Poor Geotechnical Analysis: Inadequate assessment of the soil and rock conditions at the construction site may lead to a flawed design that is not suitable for the local geological environment.

2. Substandard Construction Materials: The use of subpar or inferior quality construction materials can compromise the structural integrity of the tunnel, making it susceptible to collapse over time.

3. Lack of Quality Control: Insufficient quality control measures during construction, such as inadequate supervision and testing, may result in the oversight of critical aspects, leading to structural weaknesses.

4. Ignoring Warning Signs: Failure to heed early warning signs, such as ground movement or unusual noises, could indicate impending issues. Ignoring these signals may contribute to a catastrophic failure.

5. Rapid Construction Pace Pressures to expedite construction timelines without due consideration for safety measures and quality assurance can compromise the thoroughness of the construction process, increasing the risk of failures.



- Prevention Measures:

1. Stringent Safety Protocols: Implement and enforce strict safety protocols, ensuring that all construction activities adhere to industry standards and guidelines to prevent accidents.

2. Regular Structural Inspections: Conduct routine inspections by qualified engineers to assess the structural integrity of the tunnel during and after construction, identifying potential weaknesses and addressing them promptly.

3. Advanced Monitoring Systems: Employ advanced monitoring systems such as sensors and geotechnical instruments to continuously track the stability and conditions within the tunnel, providing real-time data for early detection of potential issues.

4. Proper Training and Supervision: Ensure that all workers receive comprehensive training on safety procedures and are supervised by experienced professionals who can identify and mitigate risks promptly.

5. Emergency Response Plan: Develop and regularly practice an emergency response plan that includes evacuation procedures, communication protocols, and coordination with local authorities to swiftly respond to unforeseen incidents.

Hi, U missed one of the most vital point. I have worked in Rishikesh-Karanprayag Railway Tunnel project for 3 years. From my experience in this project there was no Escape/Rescue tunnel which is must have for any road/railway Tunnel for safety. Lot of time I have experienced this type of blockage inside tunnels but that can be easily tackled of there was a escape tunnel parallel to the main tunnel. Sad truth now in India for cost cutting govt. allowing to go with single tunnel. Which effects the workers only. In my state West bengal also now a project going on from Sevoke to Rangpo Railway Tunnel , that is also single tunnel without any escape tunnel. I have also visited a project site here. And I can say working condition is poorest in terms of safety, quality etc.
